headline.main: Russian Prosecutors Now Say Chechen Field Held 48 Bodies

lead_paragraph: Russian prosecutors said today that 48 bodies had now been uncovered in a mass grave just outside Chechnya's capital, Grozny, a town controlled by Russian soldiers in daylight and Chechen guerrillas at night. But whether there are more bodies, who the dead were and who killed them remain in much dispute.
abstract: Vsevelod Chernov, prosecutor in pro-Russian Chechen government, reports 48 bodies have been uncovered in mass grave just outside Grozny; suggests area was makeshift cemetery for guerrillas killed in battle against Russian Army or slain in gang feuds; rebels say dead are Chechen civilians executed or tortured to death at nearby Russian military base; both rebels and civilians widely accuse Russian troops of kidnapping and imprisoning local residents, some of whom are later ransomed (M)2
